title: Siemens Shares Fall After Electrification Sales Decline
content: Siemens AG’s shares fell after orders for its electrification products declined from elevated levels, signaling a slowdown in demand driven by the boom in data centers.

title: Greencore to Buy Foodmaker Bakkavor in £1.2 Billion Deal
content: Convenience food manufacturer Greencore Group Plc agreed to buy rival Bakkavor Group Plc for about £1.2 billion ($1.6 billion).

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/15/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ives: Middle East Ahead of China in Acquiring AI Chips
content: The Trump administration is clearing a path for Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions. Under new agreements with the US, the two nations will get wider access to advanced AI chips from Nvidia and AMD. Dan Ives, Managing Director and Senior Equity Analyst at Wedbush Securities, spoke to Bloomberg’s Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on these deals. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US, Chinese Trade Negotiators Meet for Talks in South Korea
content: US and Chinese officials met for trade talks in South Korea on Thursday, just days after both sides met in Switzerland and agreed to pause some tariffs for 90 days.

title: Reliance Gets $2.98 Billion Loan, India’s Biggest Since 2023
content: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Industries has obtained a $2.98 billion-equivalent loan, according to people familiar with the matter, the largest such deal for an Indian borrower in more than a year.

title: SingPost Falls Most on Record on Underlying Loss, Gloomy Outlook
content: Singapore Post Ltd.’s shares fell by a record after the company booked an underlying loss and issued a gloomy outlook on the back the of global trade tensions.

title: Aviva’s Wealth Unit Sees £2.3 Billion Inflows as Assets Rise 5%
content: UK insurer Aviva Plc said its wealth unit saw net inflows in the first quarter, with assets under management in the business rising by 5%.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/15/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Retreat as Trade-Truce Rally Loses Steam: Markets Wrap
content: Global stocks fell on Thursday for the first time in seven sessions as the rally on Wall Street sparked by US-China trade talks showed signs of exhaustion.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Economy Grew More Than Expected in First Quarter
Pony AI CFO on Partnership with Uber in Mideast
content: Leo Haojun Wang, CFO at Pony AI, discusses the company's business strategy and its partnership with Uber to launch robotaxi services in the Middle East this year. He speaks with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Shery Ahn from the sidelines of the "Macquarie Asia Conference" on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gold Falls as Fed Rate-Cut Bets Soften, Haven Demand Ebbs
content: Gold extended its decline after falling more than 2% Wednesday on signs there will be fewer Federal Reserve rate cuts than previously anticipated, and as easing trade tensions between the US and China sapped haven demand.

title: AllianzGI CEO Would Consider Deals to Grow Private Market Assets
content: Allianz Global Investors is open to deals as part of Chief Executive Officer Tobias C. Pross’s efforts to expand the private markets business.

title: Rakuten Group Shares Sink on Worse-Than-Expected Loss
content: Rakuten Group Inc. shares tumbled by the most in five weeks after the Japanese e-commerce firm reported a 19th straight quarterly loss.

title: Merck KGaA Lowers Outlook on Tariff Risks, Currency Headwinds
content: Merck KGaA reduced its outlook for sales and profit growth this year, citing the impact of a weak US dollar and uncertainty around tariffs.

title: Oil Falls a Second Day as Iran Signals Openness to Nuclear Deal
content: Oil fell for a second day following a report Iran is willing to forgo nuclear weapons in a deal with the US in exchange for sanctions relief.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/15/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Beautiful’ Is In the Eye of the Bond Vigilantes
content: The bottom line of Trump’s desired tax cuts will be greater deficits.

title: Thyssenkrupp Holds Guidance Despite Slump in Earnings, Cash
content: Thyssenkrupp AG reaffirmed its full-year guidance even as earnings slumped due to weak demand from automotive and industrial customers.

title: Why Tencent Is Investing in AI Gaming
content: Tencent has reaffirmed a commitment to keep spending on developing AI - which may crimp profit growth in the short term. But by integrating the technology across a suite of products it hopes to reap longer-term revenue and improve gaming experience. Elinor Leung, Head of Asia Telecom and Internet Research at CLSA, speaks on Bloomberg’s The Asia Trade.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/15/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Singapore and Sydney with Avril Hong and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Singapore Home Sales Fall for Second Month as Demand Weakens
content: Singapore private home sales fell for a second month as demand for new projects dimmed at a time when trade tensions are fueling unease about the economic outlook.

title: Fidelity Adds US Stocks After ‘Pivotal’ Trade Truce With China
content: A Fidelity International fund manager said she has increased exposure to US stocks this week, citing renewed optimism following the trade truce with China.

title: Xero CEO on FY Results, Business Strategy
content: Sukhinder Singh Cassidy, CEO at Xero, discusses the company's full-year results and outlook for its business strategy. She speaks with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Avril Hong on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman Sachs Sees Limited Room for Asian IG Spreads Tightening
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. says Asian investment-grade credit spreads have limited room to tighten further after erasing the spike triggered by President Donald Trump’s early-April tariff announcement.

title: Uganda Using 'Extraordinary Measures' to Grow FX Reserves, Central Bank Governor Says
content: Bank of Uganda Governor Governor Michael Atingi-Ego says the central bank has taken "extraordinary measures" to grow the nation's foreign exchange reserves, including buying $1.5 billion from the market this fiscal year and using currency swaps. The transactions have so far amounted to $400 million, Atingi-Ego said from the capital, Kampala, in an interview with Bloomberg's Jennifer Zabasajja. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trade Chiefs Vie for Time With Greer at APEC Meeting
content: Trade chiefs from some of major economies are vying for access to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer at the APEC trade ministers’ meeting. Many are seeking talks with Greer to discuss tariffs affecting their economies and to try to mitigate the impact of Trump's trade policies. Stephen Engle reports from Jeju, South Korea. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Manhattan Rents at Record Highs Hint at More Increases to Come
content: Manhattan’s apartment market is heading into its most competitive months of the year with rents already at record highs. They’re only likely to continue rising through the summer.

title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods
content: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.

title: US Approves $304 Million Missile Sale to Turkey as Ties Warm Up
content: The US approved the sale of $304 million-worth of missiles to Turkey as the NATO allies work to strengthen trade and defense ties.

title: UniCredit Sends Letter to Berlin Saying It’s Open to Talks
content: UniCredit SpA has sent congratulatory letters to the new German government that also signaled its willingness to hold talks, according to people familiar with the matter, indicating the Italian bank is seeing a potential opening to improve fraught relations.

title: Ukraine-Russia Breakthrough Hopes Fade as NATO Diplomats Meet
content: Top US and European diplomats are gathering in Antalya, Turkey on Thursday as the outlook dims for any major breakthrough in expected peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.

title: Trade Chiefs Jostle for Time With Greer at APEC Meeting in Korea
content: Trade chiefs from some of the world’s biggest economies are competing for access to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer as they seek to advance negotiations with Washington at a gathering in South Korea.

title: Zimbabweans Escaping Economic Woes in a Bind as UK Scraps Care Visas
content: Zimbabwean workers looking to migrate to the UK by obtaining care work are in a bind after Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s administration announced plans to permanently scrap visas for that category of employees.

title: Putin Criticizes MH17 Probe in Meeting With Malaysia’s Anwar
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin criticized a United Nations probe that found his country culpable for the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17, which killed all 298 passengers and crew in 2014.

title: Serbia’s Embattled Leader Looks to Leverage Trump Family Ties
content: President Aleksandar Vucic wants to reap the rewards of cultivating links with the MAGA movement.

title: Could This Tax Overhaul Spark a UK Wealth Exodus?
content: A new study warns elimination of “nom-dom” status might just cost the government more money than it brings in. Or is the fear overblown?

title: Why Poland’s Election Is a Barometer for Europe’s Populist Wave
content: Poland’s presidential election will determine whether the country can restore the rule of law and remain a reliable partner in the European Union after nearly a decade of divisive right-wing populist rule.

title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods
content: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.

title: China Pauses Dual-Use Export Curbs Targeting US Firms
content: China has suspended a ban on exports of items with both military and civil applications — likely including some rare earths — to 28 US companies as part of the trade detente struck between the world’s two largest economies.

title: US Says It Lacks Power to Return Migrants in El Salvador Prison
content: The Trump administration urged a federal judge not to pursue the return of alleged Venezuelan gang members who were deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador, saying the US lacks authority to get the men released.

title: China’s Investors Signal Trade Truce Is No Panacea for Markets
content: The trade truce is not enough to ignite a rush into Chinese financial assets amid expectations of reduced policy stimulus and lingering uncertainty on a final deal.

title: Philippines, Germany Sign Defense Deal to Boost Arms Cooperation
content: The Philippines has signed a defense deal with Germany to expand their cooperation in weapons, logistics and cybersecurity.

title: US-Saudi $142 Billion Defense Deal Sparks Questions, Few Answers
content: The Trump administration called its $142 billion defense deal with Saudi Arabia “the largest defense sales agreement in history.” Critics aren’t so sure.

title: England’s NHS Will Dock Pay of ‘Failing’ Bosses in New Shakeup
content: England’s National Health Service will cut the salaries of leaders who fail to reduce waiting times or improve patient outcomes, the latest effort from Keir Starmer’s government to turn around the ailing state-run organization.

title: New York Republicans Signal $80,000 SALT Cap Could Be on Table
content: Two New York Republicans signaled that the cap on the state and local tax deduction may rise to as much as $80,000 as GOP lawmakers from high-tax states demand a boost in exchange for their votes on President Donald Trump’s tax package.

title: How Proposed Medicaid Cuts Would Cost 8 Million People Health Coverage
content: Republicans in Congress are negotiating a massive legislative package to realize President Donald Trump’s domestic agenda, and it won’t come cheap. Legislation advanced by House Republicans would cut taxes by almost $4.5 trillion over a decade and add hundreds of billions of dollars in new spending for defense, border wall construction, immigrant detention centers and other administration priorities.

title: US Lawmakers Urge Ban on China-Linked Router Maker TP-Link
content: Seventeen Republican lawmakers urged the Commerce Department to prohibit further sales of equipment from TP-Link Systems Inc., a Wi-Fi router maker whose links to China have raised concerns and prompted investigations in the US.

title: Qatar’s PM Defends Jet Offer, Says They’ll Withdraw If Illegal
content: Qatar’s prime minister defended his country’s offer of a luxury jet to President Donald Trump, telling CNN they would not follow through with the gift if it was deemed illegal and insisting it was not an effort to wield undue influence within the US.

title: Senate Blocks Colombia Labor Refendum in Defeat for Petro
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro suffered a major setback on Wednesday as the senate blocked his plan to hold a referendum on boosting workers’ rights.

title: Trump’s Mideast Visit Opens Floodgate of AI Deals Led by Nvidia
content: The Trump administration is clearing a path for two key Persian Gulf allies to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions — and some of the biggest US tech companies are seizing on that opening with plans to spend billions of dollars in the region.

title: Republican Tax Plan Targets Clean-Energy Supplies Tied to China
content: A Republican tax plan seeking to cut clean-energy subsidies includes provisions that threaten to end the incentives even earlier than proposed.

title: Putin Names Low-Level Officials for Talks With Ukraine in Turkey
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin named a group of low-level officials to represent his government at talks with Ukraine in Turkey, and gave no indication that he planned to join the negotiations.

title: Harvard President Garber Takes 25% Pay Cut Amid Trump Fight
content: Harvard University President Alan Garber will take a voluntary 25% pay cut for the academic year that starts July 1, a school spokesman said.

title: Judge Indicted for Blocking Migrant’s Arrest Claims Immunity
content: A Wisconsin state judge indicted for allegedly obstructing the arrest of a Mexican immigrant by US authorities said the charges should be dismissed because she’s immune from prosecution for official acts — a legal defense similar to one used by President Donald Trump.

title: Why Trade Deals and Tax Cuts May Be a Recipe for US Success
content: On this week’s Trumponomics, Stephen Moore of the Heritage Foundation argues that Donald Trump and the GOP Congress are on the right path.

title: What’s Happening in Syria, and Why Is Trump Lifting Sanctions?
content: Since the toppling of President Bashar al-Assad’s regime in December, Syrians who endured more than half a century of state repression and 13 years of civil conflict finally have a reason for optimism.

title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa to Meet Trump in Bid to Ease Tensions
content: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa plans to hold talks with his US counterpart Donald Trump in Washington on May 21 and hopes to ease a simmering diplomatic row between the two nations.

title: Peru’s Endless Political Churn Is Spreading to the Finance Minister Post
content: Peru’s messy cabinet reshuffle is spotlighting how political instability is spreading to what was once a treasured post: the finance minister.

title: Russia-Ukraine Talks in Turkey: What to Expect
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin appointed presidential aide Vladimir Medinsky to lead the delegation that will represent his government at talks with Ukraine in Turkey, and gave no indication that he planned to join the negotiations. The Russian representatives also include Deputy Foreign Minister Mikhail Galuzin, Deputy Defense Minister Alexander Fomin, and Igor Kostyukov, head of military intelligence. The composition of the Russian team is likely to fall far short of Ukraine’s expectations.

title: Steve Cohen Says Probability of US Recession Now Stands at 45%
content: Billionaire Steve Cohen said the chance of a recession in the US now stands at about 45%.

title: Gavito on Significance Of Trump Meeting Syrian Leader
content: Jen Gavito, The Cohen Group Senior Advisor, talks about the significance of President Trump meeting with Syrian Leader Ahmed Al-Sharaa in Saudi Arabia during the President's trip to the Middle East. She also discusses how Israel Prime Minster Benjamin Netanyahu may feel not visited by Trump. Jen Gavito speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Get caught up.

title: We Have to Fix SALT: Rep. LaLota On SALT Cap, Tax Bill
content: Representative Nick LaLota (R) New York weighs in on the SALT cap and discusses how the tax cuts members of the House want in the tax bill will not be extended if the tax cap of SALT is not raised. He talks about how a cap on SALT is the negotiation tool, why it's important the SALT caucus gets what they want, and when the deadline is to make a deal. Representative Nick LaLota speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Shein Lowers Prices to Lure Back US Shoppers After Tariff Cut
content: Shein Group Ltd. lowered US retail prices this week after the Trump administration temporarily cut duties on Chinese imports, as the online fashion retailer moves to win back consumers scared away by recent tariff-induced price hikes.

title: Deutsche Telekom Raises Earnings Forecast on Strong German Sales
content: Deutsche Telekom AG raised its earnings forecast for the year after quarterly profit topped estimates, helped by mobile subscriber gains in its home market of Germany.

title: Who's Paying to Dim the Sun? We Should Know.
content: Funding for solar geoengineering is growing as rapidly as the public discourse around its research and development, but it’s not a climate-change solution.

title: StanChart-Backed Algbra Partners With Gatehouse for UK Accounts
content: The UK banking arm of Kuwait’s Gatehouse Financial Group Ltd. is partnering with London-based financial technology firm Algbra Group to provide new digital accounts for overseas residents looking to invest in the UK property market.

title: America First Policy Spurs Africa Startups to Seek New Backers
content: Oko Finance, a Morgan Stanley-backed startup providing disaster insurance to farmers in Africa, was on track to become profitable this year — until US President Donald Trump’s funding cuts gutted its biggest customer.

title: Xiaomi EV Sales Fall After Deadly Crash, False Advertising Claims
content: Xiaomi Corp. electric vehicle sales in China have taken a hit since March after a fatal highway accident and consumer unhappiness around the marketing of one version of its car.

title: South Korea to Lift Deposit Insurance Cap First Time in 24 years
content: South Korea will double the deposit insurance limit to 100 million won ($71,174) per client from September, raising the cap for the first time in nearly a quarter of a century to boost confidence in the banking system.

title: Meta Picks Southeast Asia Veteran to Head Asia-Pacific Region
content: Meta Platforms Inc. is elevating its longtime head of Southeast Asia to be its senior-most business executive for the broader Asia-Pacific region, one of its main growth markets.

title: EToro IPO Nets Spark Capital $530 Million Gain From Early Bet
content: The venture firm first invested in the Israeli Robinhood competitor 15 years ago.

title: Amazon Cuts 100 From Devices Team in Corporate Jobs Pullback
content: Amazon.com Inc. is eliminating about 100 positions from its devices and services division, which works on products including the Alexa voice assistant and Kindle e-reader, highlighting the e-commerce company’s efforts to trim its corporate workforce.

title: Cisco Gives Positive Sales Forecast After AI Buoys Demand
content: Cisco Systems Inc. gave a solid forecast for revenue in the current quarter, a sign the largest seller of networking gear is benefiting from demand for systems using AI technology.

title: What’s at Stake as the US Gives Saudis Access to State-of-the-Art AI Chips
content: President Donald Trump’s administration has changed the direction of US AI policy toward two oil-rich states in the Middle East. It’s paved the way for Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to buy chips from Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. that are considered state-of-the-art when it comes to creating and running artificial intelligence software and services. Previously, the US had restrictions on delivering advanced technology to the region as part of broader controls on the sp

title: CoreWeave Drops as Sped-Up AI Investment Plans Dent Profits
content: CoreWeave Inc.’s quarterly profit forecast missed estimates as the company said it was bringing forward some spending to meet customer needs. The shares dropped as much as 11% in post-market trading.

title: US Lawmakers Urge Ban on China-Linked Router Maker TP-Link
content: Seventeen Republican lawmakers urged the Commerce Department to prohibit further sales of equipment from TP-Link Systems Inc., a Wi-Fi router maker whose links to China have raised concerns and prompted investigations in the US.

title: Trump’s Mideast Visit Opens Floodgate of AI Deals Led by Nvidia
content: The Trump administration is clearing a path for two key Persian Gulf allies to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions — and some of the biggest US tech companies are seizing on that opening with plans to spend billions of dollars in the region.

title: S&P 500 Grinds Higher As Chipmakers’ Shares Rise on Gulf Deals
content: US stocks posted a slim gain on Wednesday, as chipmakers’ shares advanced after a series of high-profile deals announced during President Donald Trump’s tour of the Persian Gulf while gains in the broader market slowed after a blistering rally.

title: Musk’s Grok Eager to Discuss ‘White Genocide’ in South Africa
content: For a brief period on Wednesday, all Elon Musk’s chatbot wanted to do was discuss a conspiracy theory about “white genocide” in South Africa.

title: Republican Plan to Sell $88 Billion of Radio Spectrum Faces Fight
content: Top Republicans are planning to auction $88 billion worth of radio spectrum to wireless broadband companies Verizon Communications Inc. and Elon Musk’s Starlink to help pay for their massive tax package — but the proposal faces stiff opposition from senators concerned about the potential impact to defense systems.

title: US AI Diffusion Rule, The Future of High-Speed Travel | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow takes a look at AI deals out of the Gulf as President Donald Trump continues his tour of the region. Plus, Sequoia Capital partner Konstantine Buhler discusses opportunities in AI memory. And Blake Scholl, CEO of Boom Supersonic, explains what an end to a ban on supersonic planes over US land could mean for the future of passenger flights. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Eight Sleep, Known For High-Tech Bedding, Expanding to China Ahead of Eventual IPO
content: New $2,849 system uses AI to monitor heart rate and breathing patterns

title: Uber, Prosus-Backed iFood Partner in Competitive Brazil Market
content: Rideshare giant Uber Technologies Inc. and Prosus NV-backed delivery service iFood are partnering to integrate their services into each others’ apps in Brazil, a strategic move to grow their presence in a market where China’s Meituan and Didi Global Inc. are also competing.

title: Microsoft Layoffs Hit Coders Hardest With AI Costs on the Rise
content: Microsoft Corp.’s recently announced job cuts fell hardest on the people who build the company’s products, showing that even software developers are at risk in the age of artificial intelligence.

title: Brazil First Lady Complains to Xi About TikTok’s Effects on Kids
content: Brazil first lady Rosangela da Silva complained to China’s leader about potentially harmful effects of TikTok on women and children during an official dinner in Beijing, continuing a crusade against social media companies that has sparked controversy before.

title: Battery Maker With 720% Stock Gain Signs Early Data-Center Deal
content: Eos Energy Enterprises Inc., whose stock has surged more than 720% over the past year, has signed an initial pact with a large-scale developer of data centers as soaring power usage boosts demand for batteries.

title: EToro Soars 42% After $620 Million Upsized IPO
content: EToro climbed as much as 42% in its first session as a public company, following a nearly $620 million upsized IPO. The trading gives EToro a market value of nearly $6 billion, based on the outstanding shares listed in an earlier filing. Katie Roof reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Apple Readies Feature That Lets Vision Pro Users Scroll With Their Eyes
content: Apple Inc. is developing a feature for its Vision Pro headset that lets users scroll through software with their eyes, aiming to enhance the device with a novel interface.

title: Misinformation Alleging Cocaine Use Gives European Leaders a Jolt
content: Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz on a train to Kyiv on May 9.

title: Uber Targets Commuters With Cheaper Pooled Rides, Price-Lock Pass
content: Uber Technologies Inc. is introducing a cheaper pooled rides option and a price-lock pass for commuters, underscoring its focus on attracting more daily users as consumers confront rising costs.

title: Telefonica Is Said to Draw Up Plans for Liberty’s VMO2 Stake
content: Telefonica SA is drawing up plans for a deal that would allow it to take control of the UK joint venture it owns with Liberty Global Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nubank Gains Post-Earnings, Bucking Profitability Concerns
content: Shares of Nu Holdings Ltd. gained on Wednesday, bucking a slump in overnight trading, after the digital bank’s first quarter earnings showed strong revenue growth weighed down by higher spending to attract new clients and protect against potential bad loans.

title: Swiss GDP Jumped Most in Two Years Before Trump Imposed Tariffs
content: Switzerland enjoyed its strongest growth spurt in two years at the start of 2025, unexpectedly accelerating before an anticipated hit from US tariffs.

title: UK Economy Has Best Quarter in a Year With 0.7% Expansion
content: The UK economy enjoyed its strongest quarterly growth in a year before the double blow of tax hikes and Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Norway’s Economy Rebounds to Biggest Gain in Almost Three Years
content: Norway’s economy surprised with better-than-expected growth in the first quarter, expanding at the fastest pace in almost three years, vindicating the central bank’s cautious stance on easing.

title: RBI Seeks to Revive Funding Market Vital for Monetary Policy
content: A dwindling borrowing market used mainly by Indian banks is showing signs of life as authorities champion its usage to lenders, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trade Chiefs Jostle for Time With Greer at APEC Meeting in Korea
content: Trade chiefs from some of the world’s biggest economies are competing for access to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer as they seek to advance negotiations with Washington at a gathering in South Korea.

title: Bank of Uganda Buys $1.5 Billion, Uses FX Swaps to Grow Reserves
content: The Bank of Uganda has bought $1.5 billion from the market this fiscal year and used currency swaps to rebuild its foreign-exchange reserves after they were drained by an aid freeze and debt repayments.

title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods
content: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.

title: China’s Glut of Coal Locks Market in Vicious Cycle of Decline
content: Chinese coal prices remain locked in a downward spiral due to a persistent glut of the fuel, according to the country’s top industry group.

title: China Pauses Dual-Use Export Curbs Targeting US Firms
content: China has suspended a ban on exports of items with both military and civil applications — likely including some rare earths — to 28 US companies as part of the trade detente struck between the world’s two largest economies.

title: What’s Going Wrong at Some Of Australia’s Biggest Banks?
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: As the regulator launches yet another probe into bank trading, what is going wrong at some of our biggest financial institutions?

title: Australia’s Jobs Soar in April, Currency Gains Ahead of RBA
content: Australian employment soared in April while the jobless rate held steady as more people sought work, highlighting the resilience of the labor market at a time when the Reserve Bank is expected to reduce interest rates further.

title: China’s Investors Signal Trade Truce Is No Panacea for Markets
content: The trade truce is not enough to ignite a rush into Chinese financial assets amid expectations of reduced policy stimulus and lingering uncertainty on a final deal.

title: Foreign Investment in Europe Tumbled Even Before US Trade War
content: A measure of foreign direct investment in Europe sank to a nine-year low in 2024, underscoring the continent’s struggle to lure business even before US President Donald Trump’s trade war darkened the economic outlook.

title: Steve Cohen Says Probability of US Recession Now Stands at 45%
content: Billionaire Steve Cohen said the chance of a recession in the US now stands at about 45%.

title: Fed’s Daly Says US Economy Still Solid, Officials Can Be Patient
content: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said the strength of the US economy allows policymakers to be patient as they wait for more evidence of how the Trump administration’s policies will affect businesses and households.

title: Why Trade Deals and Tax Cuts May Be a Recipe for US Success
content: On this week’s Trumponomics, Stephen Moore of the Heritage Foundation argues that Donald Trump and the GOP Congress are on the right path.

title: Peru’s Endless Political Churn Is Spreading to the Finance Minister Post
content: Peru’s messy cabinet reshuffle is spotlighting how political instability is spreading to what was once a treasured post: the finance minister.

title: UK Mulls New Investor Visa Targeting Key Strategic Industries
content: The UK is drawing up plans for a special visa for foreigners who invest significant sums in Britain, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government seeks to blunt the economic blow from recent tax hikes and wider curbs on work permits.

title: Carney Delays Canada Budget, Plans to Cut Income Tax by July
content: Canada will cut the lowest personal income tax rate to 14% from 15% on July 1, but Prime Minister Mark Carney’s new government won’t release a budget before the summer months.

title: US May Need a Bond-Market Blowup to Cut Deficit, Market Veteran Says
content: After the November election, there were few people in the bond market more optimistic about how President Donald Trump, and his band of DOGE cost-cutters, would rein in ballooning budget deficits than Stephen Jen.

title: Argentina Inflation Slowed in April Amid Peso Policy Change
content: Argentina’s inflation slowed down more than expected in April despite a change in the currency policy traders were betting would fan volatility.

title: Angola’s Fight Against Graft Is Losing Momentum, IMF Says
content: Angolan President Joao Lourenco’s anti-corruption drive is losing steam, putting the country’s economic growth outlook at risk, according to the International Monetary Fund.

title: Weaker Dollar Said Not to Be Part of US Tariff Negotiations
content: US officials seeking to negotiate trade deals around the world are not working to include currency policy pledges in the agreements, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Capitulates, But Buyer Beware
content: Now that the trade war between the US and China has de-escalated, everyone on Wall Street seems to think the risk of recession is greatly diminished. This suggests that Treasury yields will rise because the Federal Reserve won’t need to save the day.

title: Lula and Xi Agree to Boost Chinese Presence in Brazil Despite Trump's Threats
content: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insists he doesn’t want to pick between the US and China as his two largest trading partners wage a trade war. But it’s increasingly clear which side he has already chosen.

title: Canada’s New Tariffs on US Drop to ‘Nearly Zero’ With Exemptions, Oxford Says
content: Canada has effectively suspended almost all of its retaliatory tariffs on US products, tamping down inflation risks and improving its growth outlook, according to Oxford Economics.

title: Europe Woos Africa as Trump’s Tariff War Roils Global Trade
content: Europe can be a stable and trusted partner for Africa at a time when US President Donald Trump’s tariff war has created uncertainty in global trade, according to an European Investment Bank official.

title: Brazil Needs Fiscal Sense to Gain From Trade War, Speaker Says
content: Brazil has emerged as an early winner from Donald Trump’s trade war with China but needs to get its fiscal situation in order to attract investment and fully capitalize on the global upheaval, according to lower house Speaker Hugo Motta.

title: UK Appoints BofA Banker Jim O’Neil to Senior Treasury Post
content: The UK government appointed Jim O’Neil, a senior investment banker at Bank of America Corp., to a top position in the Treasury as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves continues a drive to boost Britain’s economic growth rate.

title: Gold’s Rally Spurs Turkish Hoarders to Splurge on Homes and Cars
content: Soaring gold prices are prompting Turkish households to convert their bullion savings into big-ticket purchases, especially homes and cars, according to a new study by the country’s central bank.

title: Siemens Shares Fall After Electrification Sales Decline
content: Siemens AG’s shares fell after orders for its electrification products declined from elevated levels, signaling a slowdown in demand driven by the boom in data centers.

title: Engie Profit Edges Down 0.9% As Utility Shuts a Nuclear Plant in Belgium and Hydropower Output Slips
content: Engie SA said first-quarter profit slipped 0.9% amid lower energy prices, declining market volatility and a drop in nuclear and hydropower generation.

title: Greencore to Buy Foodmaker Bakkavor in £1.2 Billion Deal
content: Convenience food manufacturer Greencore Group Plc agreed to buy rival Bakkavor Group Plc for about £1.2 billion ($1.6 billion).

title: Allianz Operating Profit Rises as Pimco Adds €26 Billion
content: Allianz SE, the German owner of bond firm Pacific Investment Management Co., saw first-quarter profit rise to a record amid higher income from its insurance business and inflows in asset management.

title: UK Residential Landlord Grainger Hikes Dividend After Rent Surge
content: Britain’s largest listed residential landlord boosted its dividend following a bumper period of rental income.

title: SingPost Falls Most on Record on Underlying Loss, Gloomy Outlook
content: Singapore Post Ltd.’s shares fell by a record after the company booked an underlying loss and issued a gloomy outlook on the back the of global trade tensions.

title: UniCredit Sends Letter to Berlin Saying It’s Open to Talks
content: UniCredit SpA has sent congratulatory letters to the new German government that also signaled its willingness to hold talks, according to people familiar with the matter, indicating the Italian bank is seeing a potential opening to improve fraught relations.

title: Merck KGaA Lowers Outlook on Tariff Risks, Currency Headwinds
content: Merck KGaA reduced its outlook for sales and profit growth this year, citing the impact of a weak US dollar and uncertainty around tariffs.

title: Thyssenkrupp Holds Guidance Despite Slump in Earnings, Cash
content: Thyssenkrupp AG reaffirmed its full-year guidance even as earnings slumped due to weak demand from automotive and industrial customers.

title: Geely Profits Surge on Record Sales as Reshuffle Underway
content: Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd., the Hong Kong-listed unit of billionaire Li Shufu’s sprawling auto empire, said first-quarter profit surged as sales climbed and it continued on a cost-cutting drive to stay on top of China’s ultra-competitive car market.

title: Who's Paying to Dim the Sun? We Should Know.
content: Funding for solar geoengineering is growing as rapidly as the public discourse around its research and development, but it’s not a climate-change solution.

title: Burberry Sheds Jobs, Handbag Bling as CEO Seeks Return to Roots
content: Burberry’s new boss is calling time on the British fashion label’s decade-long attempt to join the upper ranks of global luxury.

title: StanChart-Backed Algbra Partners With Gatehouse for UK Accounts
content: The UK banking arm of Kuwait’s Gatehouse Financial Group Ltd. is partnering with London-based financial technology firm Algbra Group to provide new digital accounts for overseas residents looking to invest in the UK property market.

title: Why Is Nissan in Such Financial Trouble and Can It Stage a Comeback?
content: Since the dramatic downfall of its “Cost Killer” Chairman Carlos Ghosn in 2018, Japan’s Nissan Motor Co. has labored under an aging model lineup, poor cash flow and management turmoil.

title: China’s Glut of Coal Locks Market in Vicious Cycle of Decline
content: Chinese coal prices remain locked in a downward spiral due to a persistent glut of the fuel, according to the country’s top industry group.

title: Billionaire Mittal Said to Buy ‘Beverly Hills of Dubai’ Home
content: Lakshmi Mittal, among Britain’s richest residents, is the buyer of one of Dubai’s priciest mansions, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Australia’s A$1 Million-Plus Homes Reach Record, Cotality Says
content: More than a third of homes in Australia, one of the world’s most expensive property markets, are now valued at A$1 million ($643,850) or more, according to research by consultancy Cotality.

title: Hong Kong’s Top Developer Sells Out Homes in Hours as Rates Fall
content: Hong Kong’s biggest property developer Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd. sold out the first batch of homes for a new project within hours, as the lowest mortgage rates in more than two years lured buyers.

title: UnitedHealth Is Being Probed for Medicare Fraud, WSJ Says
content: UnitedHealth Group Inc. is under criminal investigation for possible Medicare fraud, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing unidentified people familiar with the matter.

title: Dick’s Sporting Goods Nears Deal for Foot Locker
content: Dick’s Sporting Goods Inc. is in advanced talks to buy Foot Locker Inc., whose stock had dropped 41% this year amid the back-and-forth over tariffs, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: England’s NHS Will Dock Pay of ‘Failing’ Bosses in New Shakeup
content: England’s National Health Service will cut the salaries of leaders who fail to reduce waiting times or improve patient outcomes, the latest effort from Keir Starmer’s government to turn around the ailing state-run organization.

title: Harley Directors Win Reelection Following Activist Battle
content: Harley-Davidson Inc. shareholders voted to reelect three board members, including Chief Executive Officer and Chairman Jochen Zeitz, rejecting a campaign by disgruntled investor H Partners to shake up the board.

title: Azul, Creditors Are Exploring Options Including Chapter 11
content: Azul SA and its creditors are exploring options for the struggling Brazilian airline, including a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Newark Backup Data Line Failed Before 90-Second Radar Outage
content: A failed backup telecommunications line led to a 90-second radar and radio outage last month that left air traffic controllers unable to see jetliners heading into Newark airport.

title: RFK Jr. Attacks Health Agency, Defends Cuts Before Congress
content: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. defended cutting thousands of staff and attacked the agency’s past work in his first day appearing before Congress since taking the nation’s top health role.

title: Starbucks Barista Strike Over Dress Code Reaches 100 US Stores
content: Baristas at about 100 unionized Starbucks Corp. locations have walked off the job since Sunday over the company’s new dress code, according to the labor group representing the workers.

title: At Home Looks for New Overseas Suppliers Outside of China
content: At Home Group Inc. is ramping up efforts in its push to expand its supply chain away from China, according to people familiar with the matter, as the home-decor retailer looks to keep its shelves stocked while debt-restructuring talks continue.

title: New World Faces Decision Deadline on Perpetual Bond Redemption
content: The clock is ticking on New World Development Co. as the indebted Hong Kong builder must decide whether to redeem a perpetual bond before a deadline that would trigger higher interest costs on the facility.

title: Japanese Carmakers Face $19 Billion Hit From Trump’s Tariffs
content: Japan’s biggest carmakers are looking at a hit of more than $19 billion from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs that have left the global auto industry reeling.

title: Boeing Marks Comeback From Crisis With Record Qatar Air Deal
content: A year after Boeing Co. slogged through a deep executive shakeup and prolonged existential crisis, the US planemaker just landed its biggest-ever aircraft order, propelled by a powerful endorsement from President Donald Trump.

title: Banned by Uber after I won my credit card dispute — can you help?
content: There appears to be no way to modify an order and to switch from delivery to pickup in Uber's system.

content: From touch-screen bags to portable chargers and credit card protectors, shop our on the go savings. Don't miss exclusive discounts up to 70% off.

title: Debt consolidation moves borrowers should make right now
content: Stuck with high-rate credit card debt that you're looking to consolidate? Here are four timely moves to make now.

title: Credit card balances are falling. Here's how to reduce yours now.
content: Credit card balances are finally dipping — but high rates persist. Here's how to start reducing your debt for good.

title: Ella Langley Takes Credit for Riley Green's Mustache
content: Ella Langley, the winningest person at this year's ACM Awards, has an admission to make about her tourmate and duet partner Riley Green. The mustache was all her!

content: Ella Langley, the winningest person at this year's ACM Awards, has an admission to make about her tourmate and duet partner Riley Green. The mustache was all her!

title: Republican Bill to End E.V. Tax Credit Could Hurt G.M. and Ford
content: A House Republican bill introduced this week would do away with tax credits that had encouraged Americans to buy electric vehicles and automakers to invest in new factories.

title: United Way Worldwide President: A Consequential Opportunity to Expand the Child Tax Credit | Opinion
content: The Child Tax Credit matters because it is one of our most effective tools to lift children and families out of poverty.

title: but Is Still Raking In Cash From Small Donors
content: Kari Lake once ripped a rival for deceptive fundraising tactics, but many of her campaign donors are filing credit card disputes.

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
